    • Method Detail

      • setItemGlowing

        public static ProtocolOperationReturn<ItemStack> setItemGlowing(ItemStack stack,
                                                boolean isGlowing)

        Adds or removes glow to an ItemStack. This is accomplished by sending packets to the client that contain an enchantments NBT list that is empty. As with any packet or NMS modifying operation, glitches may occur. Found bugs should be filed on the GBukkitCore project.

        For this operation to succeed, a protocol library is required on the server. A lack of one will be indicated with a return value of ProtocolOperationResult.LIBRARY_NOT_AVAILABLE. However, the default reflective library is supported, therefore this method should always be capable of working.

        Implementation Note - ProtocolLib: A "magic enchant" stored on the server as a constant "flag" is used to accomplish the no-enchant glow effect. Packets which display enchantments are intercepted and rewritten before the client receives them. If this operation succeeds and no unexpected errors occur, the return value will contain ProtocolOperationResult.SUCCESS_QUEUED. The reason for this is that this method merely sets an enchantment which will be parsed by packet interceptors. Protocol operations will display the item as glowing when the appropriate packets are sent. Therefore, the rendering of the glow is not instant, and will occur in the future, hence the indication of queued behavior.

        Implementation Note - Raw Reflection: The item enchantment tag is set directly, rendering it unsafe for Bukkit API use after a call to this method. This implementation will return a value containing ProtocolOperationResult.SUCCESS upon operation success because the NBT tags are set immediately. However, for it to be effective, the returned ItemStack encapsulated in the ProtocolOperationReturn must be used.

        If the ItemStack is not a CraftItemStack, the code is not guaranteed to function properly.
        This method will return a value containing ProtocolOperationResult.FAILURE if the ItemStack already has enchantments, as conflicts would be ultimately inevitable. In addition, if it has enchantments, it already glows.

        Parameters:
        stack - The ItemStack to render as having no enchantments but having the effect.
        isGlowing - Whether to make the ItemStack artificially glow.
        Returns:
        A non-null indicator of the success of this operation, as known by the server.

      • setColor

        public static ItemStack setColor(ItemStack item,
                 DyeColor color)
        Sets the color of the specified item. The item that is passed will be unmodified after the operation.
        Parameters:
        item - The item to modify the data of.
        color - The new color of the item.
        Returns:
        The modified item.

      • setColor

        public static ItemStack setColor(ItemStack item,
                 Color color)
        Sets the color of the specified item. The item that is passed will be unmodified after the operation.
        Parameters:
        item - The item to modify the data of.
        color - The new color of the item. This is assumed to be a color representing a firework's color (not a standard color).
        Returns:
        The modified item.
        See Also:
        DyeColor.getByFireworkColor(Color)

      • setColor

        public static void setColor(Block block,
            DyeColor color)
        Sets the color of the specified block. The block that is passed will be modified by reference after the operation.
        Parameters:
        block - The block to modify the data of.
        color - The new color of the item.

      • setColor

        public static void setColor(Block block,
            Color color)
        Sets the color of the specified block. The block that is passed will be modified by reference after the operation.
        Parameters:
        block - The block to modify the data of.
        color - The new color of the item. This is assumed to be a standard color (not a firework color).
        See Also:
        DyeColor.getByColor(Color)

      • setItemName

        public static ItemStack setItemName(ItemStack item,
                    java.lang.String name)
        Sets the display name of the specified item. It also removes any existing lore. The item that is passed will be unmodified after the operation.
        Parameters:
        item - The item to modify the data of.
        name - The new display name of the item.
        Returns:
        The modified item.

      • enchant

        public static ItemStack enchant(ItemStack item,
                Enchantment enchant,
                int level)
        Enchants the specified item, ignoring restrictions on level. The item that is passed will be unmodified after the operation.
        Parameters:
        item - The item to modify the data of.
        enchant - The enchantment to apply.
        level - The one-based level at which to apply the enchant. A value of 1 indicates an enchantment level of 1 (exactly what is displayed to the user).
        Returns:
        The modified item.

      • setArmorColor

        public static ItemStack setArmorColor(ItemStack item,
                      Color color)
        Sets the color of leather armor. The item that is passed will be unmodified after the operation.
        Parameters:
        item - The item to modify the data of. If it does not have the appropriate metadata for the operation, this will throw an exception.
        color - The new color of the item.
        Returns:
        The modified item.

      • setItemNameAndLore

        public static ItemStack setItemNameAndLore(ItemStack item,
                           java.lang.String name,
                           @Nullable
                           java.lang.String... lore)
        Sets the display name and lore of the specified item. The item that is passed will be unmodified after the operation.
        Parameters:
        item - The item to modify the data of.
        name - The new display name of the item.
        lore - The new lore of the item. If this parameter is null, the lore will be set to an empty, unmodifiable list. Otherwise, it will be converted to an ArrayList and then set as the item lore.
        Returns:
        The modified item.
